itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: William Watkins (c. 1910 –  January 1972) was a Welsh rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s and 1940s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for Cross Keys RFC, and representative level rugby league (RL) for Great Britain and Wales, and at club level for Salford and wartime-guest at Oldham RLFC (Heritage № 366), as a scrum-half, i.e. number 7.
